#summary p129 control file data format.
#sidebar TOC

==p129.dat==

A typical p129.dat file has the following format:

{{{
element
mesh
partitioner
nels nn nr nip nod loaded_nodes
rho e v alpha1 beta1
nstep npri theta omega tol limit
}}}

||*Variable Name*||*Type*||*Meaning*||
||{{{element}}} || Character || The element type. Permitted value is {{{hexahedron}}}.||
||{{{mesh}}} || Integer || Element node ordering scheme. Permitted values are {{{1}}} (Smith and Griffiths scheme) or {{{2}}} (Abaqus scheme).||
||{{{nels}}} || Integer || Number of elements in the mesh.||
||{{{nn}}} || Integer || Number of nodes in the mesh.||
||{{{nr}}} || Integer || Number of restrained nodes in the mesh.||
||{{{nip}}} || Integer || Number of integration points.||
||{{{nod}}} || Integer || Number of nodes per element.||
||{{{loaded_nodes}}} || Integer || Number of nodes with externally applied loads.||
||{{{e}}} || Real || Young's modulus.||
||{{{v}}} || Real || Poisson's ratio.||
||{{{tol}}} || Real || Convergence tolerance for PCG.||
||{{{limit}}} || Integer || Iteration ceiling for PCG.||
||{{{partitioner}}} || Integer || Partitioning strategy. Permitted values are {{{1}}} (Smith and Griffiths partitioning) or {{{2}}} (use external partitioner).||

A real example follows:

{{{
'hexahedron'
2
1
2560 12465 225 8 20 17
2000 100000 0.3 0.0008 0.5
32 1 1.0 0.01 0.0001 3000
}}}
